data.text:
Question One:

When ranking the silent movie actors, I take a few things into consideration, if they make me laugh, how they make me laugh, and if I want to watch more of their films. When taking these three things into consideration I ranked the comedians as my favorite being Harold Lloyd, second being Charlie Chaplin, and my least favorite being Buster Keaton.

The reason why I liked Harold Lloyd more than the other two actors is due to the way that he made me laugh. His persona was a character that was easy to relate to and that made him seem real. It felt like I was watching a hidden camera television show that was focusing on a random person on the street that happened to have an unfortunate series of events happen to him. Whether that be, his girl coming to visit him at a job that he lied about having, or the fact that during the time that he’s guarding his girl’s father’s horsecar that he had to defend it against a group of bandits that want to keep it from running. Even though these events wouldn’t be considered funny if it happened to you, it was entertaining to watch Lloyd’s persona handle them in a way that seemed to be a little outrageous.

The little tramp managed to stumble his way into my heart and leave a smile on my face after every film. His character is one that is easy to like and want to get to know better. He seems to have this personality that has an air of childish enjoyment that makes it easy to connect to. The amount of emotion that he shows in every situation, while a little much, is interesting to watch and leaves you feeling the same way he does in the scene.
